alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 10 at 5:41PM PDT until April 12 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph, increasing to 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph Monday into Monday night. Isolated gusts to 60 mph in the western foothills. * WHERE...Antelope Valley. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Areas of blowing dust could bring significant reduction in visibility on Monday. Major roadways that will likely be impacted by the gusty winds and blowing dust include Highways 14 and 138.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
